State Revenue Extraction and Local Collection Expediency in Qing China: “Equal Sharing” of Tax Quota on “Renamed lands” in Henan Province This article investigates tax disputes between Luyi County, Henan Province, and its two neighboring counties during the Qing. That former Ming princely estates become renamed lands for taxation under the Qing only complicated the situation further. In the Ming and Qing eras, if not earlier, to account for different soil quality of various pieces of farming land, the acreage of lands was measured in different accounting units.
